title: So Is Senna going to be able to play ADC?
body: Because from what I've heard from the new road map is that she could lane with Lucian as a "Massive relic cannon".

Why would ADC Lux focus on the shield and passive procs? Those are very weak for ADC Lux because she's not building any AP. Just because it's physically possible for any champion to buy IE BT PD ER doesn't mean they can serve the purpose of an ADC, which is dealing lots of sustained damage with autoattacks, not damaging towers at range. Any champ with a ranged auto can do that, and more than just ADCs are good at taking down towers. Mages with lots of AP are quite good at it.

I certainly can blame you for calling out a statement of _fact_ when your response is _conjecture_. ADC Lux does not work in bots. Getting carried doesn't make something good or functional or viable. There are "for fun" off-meta builds, like Garen with a bunch of AP, Lich Bane, and Luden's. Then there are builds that are indistinguishable from not buying items, like Garen with six Deathcaps.

An ADC's job is to deal consistent damage not just to objectives but also to enemy champions. If their job is to be safe, then they autofail that, because most of them have such trouble laning that they need a support to accompany them (there's also ADC junglers like Yi, who have specific tools for that).

I do know what facts are. I have provided some. You have provided none. All you have is a guess based on several gross misconceptions, not the least of which is that I've ever personally tried ADC Lux. I haven't. I see other people try it from time to time, and it's always trash. It's not a fun off-meta build that can pull off some unexpected plays but falls short of optimal performance and thus isn't suitable for ranked play. It's just awful. It doesn't work.

ADCs only job is to not die in a teamfight. If that means you dont hit anyone, then you dont hit anyone. Ideally yes, youll want to be dealing consistent damage, but if teamfight damage is what youre after, then ADCs are far from the best options for that. ADCs primary role is simply damage objectives safely. This is even more important than teamfight damage, as it means you can close the game out with more on the map.

So basically, tl;dr: You cant play lux, AD or AP. K.

Any ranged champion can be an ADC. They all just rely on items anyways. However, Ahri ADC is a personal favourite of mine. 20% MS steroid, 1-2 second hard cc, three dashes, and in-lane sustain. Surprisingly decent.

Design wise, she'll likely be focused on being a support, and not really designed to act as an ADC. Considering the character and lore, however, I'd imagine Riot wouldn't want to "force her away" from being capable of playing as an ADC, as kind of a "tertiary/niche" objective with the design.

As a result, there will probably be ways to play her as an ADC, but in less of a traditional sense of the position, and more of a niche, off-meta playstyle.
